results.title: Missed bin collections | West Northamptonshire Council
results.snippet: Jan 14, 2025 ... How to report a missed bin collection. Before you report. Please check: no changes to our service have been announced - check this page or ...

results.title: Instructions | Missed bin collection (Northampton area)
results.snippet: After 7:30pm on your normal collection day. Your missed collection must be reported within 2 working days of your collection day.

results.title: Missed bin enquiry | Missed Bin Collection (Daventry)
results.snippet: This form is used by our residents to report justified missed collection: Domestic/Communal and Assisted Refuse and Recycling Collections; Clinical Sharps ...

results.snippet: Report a Missed Bin (South Northants area) Your Details Title Please select Mr Mrs Miss Ms First name Required Last Name Required Collection Address Required

results.snippet: Jun 12, 2025 ... You can also report a stray bin if the bin does not appear to belong to anyone. ... Missed bin collections · Bulky waste collection · Garden ...

results.title: Instructions | Make a WNC complaint
results.snippet: In the first instance, please report your issue directly to a service area without using this formal complaints procedure. ... Reporting a missed bin; Reporting ...

results.snippet: Report a missed bin collection · Request a new bin · Planning policy ... Find information about services in your area, search for food outlets, receive ...

results.title: Comments, compliments and complaints | West Northamptonshire ...
results.snippet: This is not a complaint and will be passed to the responsible service to action. Some examples of a service request would be: a missed bin collection; reporting ...

results.title: Instructions | New Bin Order Form
results.snippet: Use this form to order your first set of bins or if you have moved into a property that is missing any of the standard bins.

list_analysis.pilot_result:
Based on the given context and priority factors to consider, I have evaluated the analysis results with the additional requirements of making up to three selections from available options while maintaining a minimum confidence score of 0.6. Here's my recommended JSON structure for the next steps:

```json

 {
  "Number": "1",

 },
 {

  "Reasoning": "This link provides detailed instructions on how to report a missed bin collection within Northampton, offering a quick and efficient process.",
  "Confidence": "75"
 },
 {
  "Number": "3",
  "Title": "Missed bin enquiry | Missed Bin Collection (Daventry)",
  "Source": "https:\/\/www.northampton.gov.uk\/xfp\/form\/494?council=wnc",
  "Reasoning": "This link offers a targeted form for reporting missed bin collections in Daventry, addressing the specific needs of customers residing there.",
  "Confidence": "70"
}
]
```

My algorithm selected the following options for optimal information gathering journeys:

1. The first recommendation because it has broad applicability (covering the entire West Northamptonshire Council area) and provides comprehensive instructions on reporting a missed bin collection.
2. The second recommendation due to its specific focus on the Northampton area, offering detailed instructions in an effective format.
3. Lastly, I chose the third recommendation because it targets Daventry residents with a direct form for reporting missed collections, addressing their unique needs.
